net.happybrackets.rendererengine

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.happybrackets.rendererengine.Renderer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GranularRenderer

    public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Renderer is the base class to be used when developing a sketch that runs a synchronized composition using Sound and Lights The Renderer class needs to be extended by the sketch that will be sent to the devices. The sketch can optionally implements HBAction. Check the example at the HappyBrackets Plugin default project on examples/rendererengine/renderer

                         int green,

        Wrapper method that trigger the RendererController.displayColor(Renderer, int, int, int) for this Renderer object

        green - RGB green component
        blue - RGB blue component

        public void displayColor(int[] RGB)
        Wrapper method that trigger the RendererController.displayColor(Renderer, int, int, int) for this Renderer object
        Parameters:
        RGB - array of 3 int composing RGB

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.String hostname,
                       Renderer.Type type,
                       float x,
                       float y,
                       float z,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       int id)
        This method will be called by the RendererController. No need to be used. Use RendererController.addRenderer(net.happybrackets.rendererengine.Renderer.Type, java.lang.String, float, float, float, java.lang.String, int) instead.
        Parameters:
        hostname - device hostname
        type - Renderer type
        x - x position
        y - y position
        z - z position
        name - Renderer name
        id - Renderer id
